basics.name: Jessica Grazziotin
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2018.

work.summary: Assembled and Programmed a Liquid Metal Deposition System
highlights: Assembled and Programmed a Liquid Metal Deposition System
Main Components: Thor Labs Linear Actuators, Fluigent Microfluidics Control System, Matlab

work.summary: Designed a portable data aquisition device with complementary GUI software
highlights: Designed a portable data aquisition device with complementary GUI software
Main Components: Arduino Uno, 16bit ADC, standard photo sensing element, C and Python languages

work.summary: Explored Ruby on Rails & designed a Wearable Electronic Comic Con Piece
highlights: Added profiles to a membership portal, updated a static website using Jekyll
Rapidly prototyped and designed a wearable electronic device in three weeks to present at The Amazing ComicCon
Device: LED light up glasses controlled by a microcontroller encased in a 3D printed necklace housing
Main Components: Arduino pro mini, 4 LED light strips, C language, 3D printed housing

volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
